criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all major dialogue content: patient's difficulty remembering losartan while on the road, attempted phone reminders, driving limitation, clinician suggestions of pill organizer and consistent bedtime dosing, patient concern about sleep impact, and clinician reassurance about losartan and need for blood-pressure stability.
Penalize for omitting, altering, or assigning to the wrong speaker any of the above major dialogue elements, resulting in an incomplete or distorted narrative of the encounter.

Reward for correctly incorporating only relevant chart information that supports the transcript (e.g., 45-year-old male with hypertension on losartan 50 mg) and excluding data not pertinent to the conversation.

Penalize for selectively or wholesale copying chart details (e.g., diabetes, metformin, family history) that were not referenced or needed to understand the encounter, or for inaccurately importing chart data.
Penalize for introducing clinical decisions or actions not present in the transcript—such as medication changes, lab orders, referrals, or new diagnoses—thereby fabricating content.
Reward for precise transcription of factual details—medication name, strength (losartan 50 mg), suggested dosing time (bedtime), and patient demographics—exactly as found in transcript and chart.
Penalize for any factual inaccuracies (wrong medication name, dose, patient age, or misquoted statements) that conflict with transcript or chart.
